remarks: If there are two inverses of an morphism, these inverses are equal. Corollary 3.11 of [Adamek] p. 28.  (Contributed by AV, 10-Apr-2017.)
statement:
inveq.b $e |- B = ( Base ` C ) $.
inveq.h $e |- H = ( Hom ` C ) $.
inveq.n $e |- N = ( Inv ` C ) $.
inveq.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. Cat ) $.
inveq.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. B ) $.
inveq.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. B ) $.
inveq $p |- ( ph -> ( ( F ( X N Y ) G /\ F ( X N Y ) K ) -> G = K ) ) $.
